articles.title: What is CODRocket?
articles.body: CODRocket is a lightweight Shopify app that lets merchants accept Cash on Delivery (COD) payments by adding a configurable COD Buy Button and an order form to product and checkout flows. It helps merchants collect delivery instructions, capture extra fees or conditional charges for COD handling, and tag orders so they can be filtered and processed separately.

articles.title: How to Install CODRocket on Your Shopify Store
articles.body: 1) From the Shopify App Store, find CODRocket and click 'Add app'. 2) Grant the requested store permissions (orders, scripts, and storefront access). 3) After installation, open the CODRocket dashboard from your Shopify admin Apps section.

articles.title: Quick Setup Guide (First COD Button)
articles.body: 1) In the CODRocket dashboard choose 'Quick start' → 'Add COD Button'. 2) Pick the placement (product page, cart, or a floating action button) and set a label (for example, 'Pay by COD'). 3) Save and preview on a product page — use a development/sandbox theme first. 4) Place a test order to verify the button appears and the order flow captures the COD option and tags the order.

articles.title: System Requirements & Compatibility
articles.body: CODRocket supports modern Shopify themes (Online Store 2.0 and most legacy themes). Recommended: Shopify store with theme version that supports app blocks for easier placement. Browser compatibility: latest desktop and mobile browsers. If your theme heavily customizes checkout, contact support for guidance on placing the COD Buy Button.

articles.title: Customizing the COD Buy Button (Placement & Options)
articles.body: Place the COD Buy Button on product pages, inside the cart, or as a floating button. Options include the button text, color presets, and whether the button opens a modal order form or navigates to a separate page. Test placements across devices to ensure visibility without blocking important CTAs.

articles.title: Building & Editing Your Order Form
articles.body: The order form captures buyer information required for COD fulfillment (delivery instructions, phone confirmation, optional cash collection notes). Use the form editor to add, remove, or reorder fields. Fields can be marked required, and you can optionally include conditional fields that appear based on customer selections.

articles.title: Setting Up Shipping Rules & Conditional Charges
articles.body: Define shipping rules and conditional COD handling fees based on cart totals, shipping zones, or product tags. For example, add a fixed COD handling fee for orders under a threshold or exclude COD for certain shipping countries. Rules are evaluated at checkout to present accurate totals to customers.

articles.title: Multi-Language & Localization Settings
articles.body: CODRocket supports localization for button text and form labels. Translate the strings for each supported storefront language from the Settings → Localization panel. If your theme uses a language switcher, verify that translations render correctly on product and cart pages.

articles.title: Styling & Branding with Custom CSS
articles.body: If you need finer control, add custom CSS snippets in the app settings to match your store branding. Use the theme inspector to target the correct selectors and preview changes in a sandbox theme. Keep CSS minimal to avoid conflicts when you update themes.

articles.title: Where to Find COD Orders in Shopify
articles.body: COD orders are regular Shopify orders that include a COD tag (configurable from the app). To find them quickly, filter your Orders view by the COD tag or create a saved search.

articles.title: Automatic Order Tagging & Filtering
articles.body: CODRocket can automatically tag orders when a customer selects the COD option. Tags can include metadata such as the COD fee applied, delivery instructions summary, and originating page (product, cart). Use these tags to build automated workflows or reporting filters.

articles.title: Exporting COD Orders for Logistics Partners
articles.body: Use the export feature to generate CSVs containing COD order details (customer name, address, phone, COD amount, and notes). Exports can be filtered by date range, fulfillment status, or shipping zone for integration with logistics partners.

articles.title: Tracking COD Performance with Analytics
articles.body: The app provides basic analytics showing COD adoption rate, average COD order value, and refund rates. Combine this with Shopify analytics to evaluate the impact on conversion and fulfillment overhead. Exportable reports let you share metrics with finance or logistics teams.

articles.title: Overview: Free vs Paid Plans
articles.body: CODRocket offers a free tier to get started with basic functionality (single COD button, limited analytics). Paid plans unlock advanced features: multiple button placements, conditional shipping rules, advanced exports, and priority support.

articles.title: How to Upgrade or Downgrade Your Plan
articles.body: Change plans from the app dashboard under Billing. Upgrades are applied immediately and billed pro-rata through Shopify. Downgrades take effect at the next billing cycle.

articles.title: Billing & Invoices in Shopify
articles.body: Billing is handled through Shopify’s app billing system. You can view invoices from your Shopify admin under Settings → Billing → App charges. For any billing disputes, contact support with your store ID and invoice number.

articles.title: Frequently Asked Questions About Plans & Payments
articles.body:
Q: Will I lose settings when I downgrade?
A: Most settings are preserved but some premium features will be disabled. We recommend exporting configuration or contacting support before making large billing changes.
Q: Is there a trial?
A: Trial availability is shown on the pricing page inside the app and in the Shopify App Store listing.

articles.title: COD Button Not Showing: How to Fix
articles.body:
1) Make sure the app is installed and the button placement is enabled for the theme you are previewing. Use the theme selector in the app to target the correct theme.
2) Clear caches and browser storage, then hard-refresh the page. If your theme uses a page builder, verify that the product template includes the section where the app block is inserted.

articles.title: Form Not Submitting or Saving Orders
articles.body: Check for Javascript console errors and theme conflicts. If the form opens but fails to submit, ensure required fields are correctly configured and not blocked by a third-party script. Temporarily disable other apps that modify checkout flow to isolate the conflict.

articles.title: Styling or Layout Issues (Theme Conflicts)
articles.body: Most layout problems are fixed by adding a small CSS override in the app settings. Use the theme inspector to find the conflicting selector. If the issue is caused by a legacy theme, contact support for a guided fix.

articles.title: Duplicate Orders or Incorrect Data
articles.body: Verify that customers are not double-submitting forms (check form submit button states) and that your checkout apps are not duplicating the workflow. If order data is missing, check the app's permissions and the order notes/attributes the app writes to Shopify.

articles.title: General Frequently Asked Questions
articles.body:
Q: Can I disable COD for specific products?
A: Yes, use product tags to exclude items from COD or set rules in the Shipping & Rules section.
Q: How long does support take to respond?
A: Response times vary by plan — priority support is available for paid tiers.

articles.title: How to Contact CODRocket Support
articles.body: Contact support from the app dashboard (Help → Contact Support) or email our support team with your store URL, screenshots, and a concise description of the issue. Include steps to reproduce and any error messages.

articles.title: Submitting Feature Requests or Feedback
articles.body: Use the 'Suggest a feature' flow in the app or create a ticket with details about your use case. Product team reviews incoming requests and prioritizes them by impact and demand.

articles.title: Release Notes & Latest Updates
articles.body: View release notes inside the app under 'Updates'. This includes bug fixes, new features, and important migration notices.

articles.title: Privacy & Data Protection Practices
articles.body: CODRocket only stores data necessary to operate the app (order tags, minimal form responses). We do not store full payment credentials and we follow Shopify's data protection guidelines. For details see our Privacy Policy.

articles.title: Terms of Service & Refund Policy
articles.body: Terms and refund guidelines are available from the app dashboard and on the website. For billing disputes or refund requests, provide your store ID and invoice reference when contacting support.
